text.headline:
Aritificial Intelligence
2000-2022
text.text: AI is one of the most elsuive subjects in Computer Science. Our advances in past two decades was chienfly about specialized IA.

text.headline: Why the Future Doesn't Need Us?
text.text: Our most powerful 21st-century technologies: robotics, genetic engineering, and nanotech are threatening to make humans an endangered species. B. Joy, “Why the Future Doesn’t Need Us,” WIRED, Apr. 2000. [Online]. Available: https://www.wired.com/2000/04/joy-2/. [Accessed: Aug. 25, 2022]

text.headline: First-order logic
text.text: Logic and computer science; fields who cannot be separated. These years is about make intelligent agents by logic and probalistic theory. Halpern, J., Harper, R., Immerman, N., Kolaitis, P. G., Vardi, M. & Vianu, V., 2001, “On the Unusual Effectiveness of Logic in Computer Science,” The Bulletin of Symbolic Logic, 7.2: 213–236. Pollock, J., 2001, “Defeasible Reasoning with Variable Degrees of Justification,” Artificial Intelligence, 133, 233–282. Amir, E. & Maynard-Reid, P., 2001, “LiSA: A Robot Driven by Logical Subsumption,” in Proceedings of the Fifth Symposium on the Logical Formalization of Commonsense Reasoning, (New York, NY). https://plato.stanford.edu/entries/artificial-intelligence/

text.headline: Smartphones arrived
text.text: Smartphones allow big data. AI weak are with us. “OpenMind,” OpenMind, 2019. [Online]. Available: https://www.bbvaopenmind.com/en/articles/the-past-decade-and-future-of-ais-impact-on-society/. [Accessed: Aug. 25, 2022]

text.headline: Will Robots Steal Your Job?
text.text: Whatever your situation, you should be afraid. http://www.facebook.com/farhad.manjoo, “Will robots steal your job? If you’re highly educated, you should still be afraid.,” Slate Magazine, 2011. [Online]. Available: https://www.slate.com/articles/technology/robot_invasion/2011/09/will_robots_steal_your_job.html. [Accessed: Aug. 25, 2022]

text.headline: A milostone in the history of deep learning: ImageNet
text.text: In the competition ImageNet, Alex Krizhevsky, Ilya Sutskever and Krizhevsky made accurate predictions of the objects suchas as cats and faces. “OpenMind,” OpenMind, 2019. [Online]. Available: https://www.bbvaopenmind.com/en/articles/the-past-decade-and-future-of-ais-impact-on-society/. [Accessed: Aug. 25, 2022]

text.headline: Generative Adversial Networks
text.text: Genetive Adversial Networks was introduced in 2014. Sagar, “A Decade Of AI: Most Defining Moments 2010-20,” Analytics India Magazine, Jan. 05, 2021. [Online]. Available: https://analyticsindiamag.com/ai-top-decade-2010-2020-breakthroughs/. [Accessed: Aug. 25, 2022]

text.headline: Open source library to make machine learning models
text.text: TensorFlow and Pytorch were open-sourced by Google and Facebook respectly.  R. Sagar, “A Decade Of AI: Most Defining Moments 2010-20,” Analytics India Magazine, Jan. 05, 2021. [Online]. Available: https://analyticsindiamag.com/ai-top-decade-2010-2020-breakthroughs/. [Accessed: Aug. 25, 2022]

text.headline: Companies make AI hardware
text.text: Since backprogration is hard, companies like Apple deploy AI Bionic, NVIDIA Jetson AGX Xavier developer kit, and Google's Coral kit. Sagar, “A Decade Of AI: Most Defining Moments 2010-20,” Analytics India Magazine, Jan. 05, 2021. [Online]. Available: https://analyticsindiamag.com/ai-top-decade-2010-2020-breakthroughs/. [Accessed: Aug. 25, 2022]

text.headline: A step to Strong Artificial Intelligence
text.text: OpenAI trained a robot like an human to manipulate a physical object such as Rubik's Cube. [1] Marcin Andrychowicz, “Learning Dexterity,” OpenAI, Jul. 30, 2018. [Online]. Available: https://openai.com/blog/learning-dexterity/. [Accessed: Aug. 25, 2022]

text.headline: Artificial Intelligence: A Modern Approach 4th edition was released.
text.text: A new edition for the foundational book was released; authors have added Deep Learning and Reinforcement Learning. [1] “Artificial Intelligence: A Modern Approach, 4th US ed.,” Berkeley.edu, 2022. [Online]. Available: http://aima.cs.berkeley.edu/. [Accessed: Aug. 25, 2022]
